title: Preparing Walls for Painting
description: Step-by-step wall prep: covering furniture, taping edges, filling cracks, sanding, and priming for a flawless paint job.

![Wall preparation before painting](/images/podgotovka/paint_4.png)

# Preparing Walls for Painting

> Flawless, long-lasting paint starts before you even open the can ‚Äî with proper **wall preparation**: covering, spackling, sanding, and priming.

Even the most expensive paint won't give you a smooth, durable finish if your walls aren't prepared.  
These simple steps will help you avoid mistakes and unnecessary costs.

---

## 1. Covering Floors and Furniture

![Covering floors and furniture](/images/podgotovka/step1.png)

Before starting work, cover the floor with a protective plastic sheet or heavy cloth. This will protect against stains.  
If you can't move furniture out ‚Äî cover it with plastic and secure the covering with painter's tape.

üí° **Pro tip:** use construction tape with an attached plastic sheet already attached ‚Äî it saves time and nerves.

---

## 2. Taping Corners and Baseboards

![Taping corners and baseboards](/images/podgotovka/step2.png)

Painter's tape is essential for crisp paint lines. Use it to mask baseboards, trim, outlets, and light switches.

- The tape should be pressed down firmly, otherwise paint will bleed through.
- Remove the tape right after painting, while the paint is still slightly wet.

üí° **Pro tip:** choose quality tape ‚Äî cheap options leave residue and tear easily.

---

## 3. Filling Cracks and Gaps with Spackle

![Filling cracks with spackle](/images/podgotovka/step3.png)

All defects need to be filled with spackle: cracks, chips, and bumps.

1. Clean the crack of dust.
2. Fill it with spackle using a putty knife.
3. Remove excess and smooth the surface.
4. After it dries, lightly sand it.

üí° **Pro tip:** for deep cracks, apply several thin coats, otherwise the spackle will crack.

---

## 4. Sanding the Surface

![Sanding the wall](/images/podgotovka/step4.png)

Sanding removes bumps and remnants of old paint.

- Use fine-grit sandpaper (P120‚ÄìP180) or sanding mesh.
- Work evenly, without heavy pressure.
- After sanding, remove dust with a damp sponge or vacuum.

üí° **Pro tip:** attach sandpaper to a sanding block or use an orbital sander ‚Äî the result is faster and smoother.

---

## 5. Priming the Walls

![Applying primer](/images/podgotovka/step5.png)

Primer strengthens the base and improves paint adhesion.

1. Stir the primer.
2. Apply with a roller on large areas, use a brush in corners.
3. Let the coat dry (usually 4‚Äì6 hours).

üí° **Pro tip:** don't skimp on primer ‚Äî it will reduce paint consumption and extend the life of the finish.

---

## üìê Paint Calculator

Before moving on to painting, calculate how many gallons of paint you'll need for your room:

<PaintCalculator />

Example: room 16√ó10 ft, ceiling 9 ft, without large windows ‚âà **6‚Äì7 gallons** of paint.

---

## ‚úÖ Summary

Preparation takes longer than the painting itself, but it determines the quality of the result.  
Follow each step ‚Äî and the paint will go on smooth, without drips or bubbles, and your walls will look great for many years.

---
